name.text: An Interactive Pie chart showing the amount of money spent by a school on foodstuff in a month

questiontext.text:
The table below shows the amount of money spent by a school on foodstuff in a month.

Complete the table by finding their respective angles


Food Item Quantity (kg) Degrees
Rice \({@random_rice@}\) [[input:ans8]][[validation:ans8]]
Beans \({@random_beans@}\) [[input:ans9]][[validation:ans9]]
Vegetables \({@random_vegetables@}\) [[input:ans10]][[validation:ans10]]
Meat \({@random_meat@}\) [[input:ans11]][[validation:ans11]]
Sugar \({@random_sugar@}\) [[input:ans12]][[validation:ans12]]
Maize \({@random_maize@}\) [[input:ans13]][[validation:ans13]]


After calculating the angles ,drag the sliders to angles representing the foodstuffs bought by the school

[[feedback:prt8]]

[[jsxgraph width="750px" height="450px" input-ref-ans17="sR1" input-ref-ans18="sR2" input-ref-ans19="sR3" input-ref-ans20="sR4" input-ref-ans21="sR5" input-ref-ans22="sR6"]] JXG.Options.text.useMathJax = true; var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard(divid, { boundingBox: [-3, 2, 3, -2], showCopyright: false, showNavigation: false, keepAspectRatio: true, grid: false }); // Categories and colors for pie chart var categories = ["Rice", "Beans", "Vegetables", "Meat", "Sugar", "Maize"]; var colors = ["red", "blue", "green", "orange", "purple", "cyan"]; // Define sliders for each category (whole numbers only) var sliders = [ board.create('slider', [[-2.8, 1.5], [-2, 1.5], [10, 60, 180]], {name: "Rice", snapWidth: 1}), board.create('slider', [[-2.8, 1.3], [-2, 1.3], [10, 50, 180]], {name: "Beans", snapWidth: 1}), board.create('slider', [[-2.8, 1.1], [-2, 1.1], [10, 40, 180]], {name: "Vegetables", snapWidth: 1}), board.create('slider', [[-2.8, 0.9], [-2, 0.9], [10, 90, 180]], {name: "Meat", snapWidth: 1}), board.create('slider', [[-2.8, 0.7], [-2, 0.7], [10, 60, 180]], {name: "Sugar", snapWidth: 1}), board.create('slider', [[-2.8, 0.5], [-2, 0.5], [10, 60, 180]], {name: "Maize", snapWidth: 1}) ]; // Define pie chart center and radius var center = [1, 0]; var radius = 1.5; var sectors = []; var textLabels = []; // Function to update the pie chart based on slider values function updateChart() { var angles = sliders.map(s => Math.round(s.Value())); // Ensure whole numbers var total = angles.reduce((a, b) => a + b, 0); angles = angles.map(a => Math.round((a / total) * 360)); // Ensure whole numbers var startAngle = 0; for (let i = 0; i < angles.length; i++) { let angleDegrees = angles[i]; let endAngle = startAngle + angleDegrees; let startRad = (startAngle * Math.PI) / 180; let endRad = (endAngle * Math.PI) / 180; let p1 = board.create('point', [center[0] + radius * Math.cos(startRad), center[1] + radius * Math.sin(startRad)], { visible: false }); let p2 = board.create('point', [center[0] + radius * Math.cos(endRad), center[1] + radius * Math.sin(endRad)], { visible: false }); if (sectors[i]) board.removeObject(sectors[i]); if (textLabels[i]) board.removeObject(textLabels[i]); sectors[i] = board.create('sector', [center, p1, p2], { fillColor: colors[i], strokeColor: "black", strokeWidth: 1, fillOpacity: 0.7 }); let midAngle = startAngle + angleDegrees / 2; let midRad = (midAngle * Math.PI) / 180; let labelX = center[0] + radius * 0.8 * Math.cos(midRad); let labelY = center[1] + radius * 0.8 * Math.sin(midRad); textLabels[i] = board.create('text', [labelX, labelY, categories[i] + " (" + angleDegrees + "Â°)"], { // Whole numbers only fontSize: 14, anchorX: 'middle', anchorY: 'middle', fixed: true }); startAngle = endAngle; } } // Attach event listeners to update the pie chart when sliders are moved sliders.forEach(slider => slider.on("drag", updateChart)); // Bind slider values to STACK inputs stack_jxg.bind_point(sR1, sliders[0]); stack_jxg.bind_point(sR2, sliders[1]); stack_jxg.bind_point(sR3, sliders[2]); stack_jxg.bind_point(sR4, sliders[3]); stack_jxg.bind_point(sR5, sliders[4]); stack_jxg.bind_point(sR6, sliders[5]); // Initialize the chart updateChart(); [[/jsxgraph]]

[[input:ans17]][[input:ans18]][[input:ans19]][[input:ans20]][[input:ans21]][[input:ans22]]

[[validation:ans17]][[validation:ans18]][[validation:ans19]][[validation:ans20]][[validation:ans21]][[validation:ans22]]

[[feedback:prt17]]

use the information you provided above to answer the questions below

  1. What is the total quantity of food items bought by the school?[[input:ans1]][[validation:ans1]][[feedback:prt1]]

  2. Which food item had the highest quantity? [[input:ans2]][[validation:ans2]][[feedback:prt2]]

  3. Which food item had the least quantity?[[input:ans3]] [[validation:ans3]][[feedback:prt3]]

  4. What is the percentage of the total quantity that is maize? [[input:ans4]] [[validation:ans4]][[feedback:prt4]]

  5. What is the sum of the angles for rice and maize? [[input:ans5]] [[validation:ans5]][[feedback:prt5]]

  6. What is the difference in degrees between beans and meat? [[input:ans6]] [[validation:ans6]][[feedback:prt6]]

  7. If the school decides to double the quantity of vegetables, what will its new angle be? [[input:ans7]] [[validation:ans7]][[feedback:prt7]]

  8. How many more kilograms of meat were bought than beans? [[input:ans14]] [[validation:ans14]][[feedback:prt14]]

  9. What fraction of the total quantity is sugar? [[input:ans15]] [[validation:ans15]][[feedback:prt15]]

  10. What is the total angle sum of meat, vegetables, and sugar? [[input:ans16]] [[validation:ans16]][[feedback:prt16]]

generalfeedback.text:
Worked Solution

  1. Total Quantity of Food Items was \({@Total_values@}\)

  2. Food Item with the Highest Quantity was \({@max_item@}\)

  3. Food Item with the Least Quantity \({@min_item@}\)

  4. Percentage of the total quantity that is maize was \({@percentage_rice@}\)

  5. The sum of the angles for rice and maize was \({@sum_angles_rice_beans@}\)

  6. The difference in degrees between beans and meat was \({@diff_meat_maize@}\)

  7. The new angle for vegetables if its quantity is doubled was \({@new_angle_vegetables@}\)

  8. Difference in Kilograms between meat and beans was \({@diff_meat_beans@}\)

  9. Fraction of the total quantity is sugar was \({@fraction_maize@}\)

  10. Total angle sum of meat, vegetables, and sugar was \({@sum_angles_meat_veg_sugar@}\)

questiondescription.text:
Joseph Baya Karisa

[ ]

[ ]

The table displays the quantity of various food items bought by a school in a month. Students must calculate the corresponding angles for each food item based on their quantities to complete the table. Afterward, they will use sliders to visually represent these angles on a pie chart and answer related questions about the data.

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

Your value for pie chart for the Maize is incorrect.
